en_first_half: When Mr. Lorry had finished his breakfast, he went out for a stroll on the beach. The little narrow, crooked town of Dover hid itself away from the beach, and ran its head into the chalk cliffs, like a marine ostrich. The beach was a desert of heaps of sea and stones tumbling wildly about, and the sea did what it liked, and what it liked was destruction. It thundered at the town, and thundered at the cliffs, and brought the coast down, madly. The air among the
en_second_half: houses was of so strong a piscatory flavour that one might have supposed sick fish went up to be dipped in it, as sick people went down to be dipped in the sea. A little fishing was done in the port, and a quantity of strolling about by night, and looking seaward: particularly at those times when the tide made, and was near flood. Small tradesmen, who did no business whatever, sometimes unaccountably realised large fortunes, and it was remarkable that nobody in the neighbourhood could endure a lamplighter.
en_results: beach huts and the fishermen's boats was filled with the cries of gulls, their raucous calls echoing off the grey stone walls of the old town. The sea spray carried the smell of salt and seaweed, mingling with the acrid scent of the coal smoke from the factories that lined the shore. The wind whipped the waves into a frenzy, sending spume flying high into the air, where it was caught by the gusts and blown back down, stinging the skin of anyone who dared to venture too close to the water's edge. The beach was
en_results_raw: The air among the beach huts and the fishermen's boats was filled with the cries of gulls, their raucous calls echoing off the grey stone walls of the old town. The sea spray carried the smell of salt and seaweed, mingling with the acrid scent of the coal smoke from the factories that lined the shore. The wind whipped the waves into a frenzy, sending spume flying high into the air, where it was caught by the gusts and blown back down, stinging the skin of anyone who dared to venture too close to the water's edge. The beach was a place of constant turmoil, where the forces of nature clashed in a never-ending battle for dominance. The sound of the waves crashing against the shore was a constant drumbeat, a reminder of the power and fury of the sea. As Mr. Lorry walked along the beach, he felt the sand shifting beneath his feet, the grains slipping and sliding as the waves retreated and advanced, leaving behind a trail of foam and debris. The beach was a place of endless change, where nothing remained still for long, and where the only constant was the relentless pounding of the waves against the shore.

es_first_half: Terminado el almuerzo, el señor Lorry salió a dar un paseíto por la playa. No se divisaba desde ella la pequeña e irregular ciudad de Dover, excepción hecha de sus tejados que, metidos entre picachos de canteras calizas, semejaban gigantesca ostra marina. Era la playa un desierto erizado de peñascales y plagado de escollos, donde la mar hacía lo que se la antojaba, y lo que se la antojaba invariablemente era destruir. Casi de continuo rugía contra la ciudad, bramaba contra los farallones, embestía contra los peñascos que pretendían oponerse a su paso y los derribaba con estruendo. Respirábase en las casas un olor tan fuerte a pescado, que no parecía sino que los
es_second_half: habitantes de las aguas salían de éstas para curar en las casas sus enfermedades, de la misma manera que las personas enfermas suelen buscar la salud en los baños de mar. Algunos, muy pocos, se dedicaban a la pesca en aquellas aguas, y si durante el día la playa estaba siempre desierta, en cambio por la noche se veían personas que clavaban sus miradas inquietas en la inmensidad del mar. Comerciantes insignificantes a los que nunca se veía hacer un negocio, realizaban de pronto fortunas inmensas que no tenían explicación racional, y era muy de notar que nadie, por aquellos lugares, podía sufrir la presencia de una luz, de la que huían como del demonio.

en_first_half: Madame Defarge, his wife, sat in the shop behind the counter as he came in. Madame Defarge was a stout woman of about his own age, with a watchful eye that seldom seemed to look at anything, a large hand heavily ringed, a steady face, strong features, and great composure of manner. There was a character about Madame Defarge, from which one might have predicated that she did not often make mistakes against herself in any of the reckonings over which she presided. Madame Defarge being sensitive to cold, was wrapped in fur, and had a quantity of bright shawl twined about her head,
en_second_half: though not to the concealment of her large earrings. Her knitting was before her, but she had laid it down to pick her teeth with a toothpick. Thus engaged, with her right elbow supported by her left hand, Madame Defarge said nothing when her lord came in, but coughed just one grain of cough. This, in combination with the lifting of her darkly defined eyebrows over her toothpick by the breadth of a line, suggested to her husband that he would do well to look round the shop among the customers, for any new customer who had dropped in while he stepped over the way.
en_results: as she sat behind the counter, her eyes scanning the room with a calculating intensity that seemed to miss nothing. en_results_raw: as she sat behind the counter, her eyes scanning the room with a calculating intensity that seemed to miss nothing. The fire crackled and spat in the hearth, casting flickering shadows on the walls as the chill of the winter evening seeped into the shop. Outside, the snow fell gently, casting a serene silence over the streets of Paris. But inside, the atmosphere was tense, the air thick with the weight of secrets and unspoken words. Madame Defarge's husband, Monsieur Defarge, stood at the counter, his eyes fixed on his wife as he waited for her to acknowledge his presence. He was a man of average height, with a rugged face and a sharp jawline, his dark hair flecked with grey at the temples. His eyes, a deep brown, seemed to hold a world of emotion, a depth that was both captivating and unnerving. As he waited, he seemed to be holding his breath, his entire being focused on the woman who sat behind the counter, her eyes still fixed on some point beyond him. The silence between them was palpable, heavy with anticipation, as if the very fate of the world hung in the balance. And then, without looking up, Madame Defarge spoke, her voice low and even, "What brings you here, Monsieur...?" Her eyes never left the point beyond him, her gaze seeming to bore into the very soul of the man who stood before her. The air seemed to vibrate with tension as the words hung in the air, waiting for a response, a response that would set in motion a chain of events that would change the course of history forever.

El tabernero, al ver que no había nadie más en la taberna, se acercó a la mesa y se sentó a su lado, sin decir nada, y comenzó a mirarla con una expresión seria, como si esperara que ella dijera algo. Pero la mujer seguía en silencio, con la mirada fija en el suelo, como si no hubiera oído nada. El tabernero, cada vez más impaciente, comenzó a hablar, pero la mujer no respondió, y el tabernero se dio cuenta de que algo no estaba bien. La tensión en la habitación se hizo palpable, y el tabernero se preguntó qué había pasado entre ellos, y qué iba a pasar a continuación.

en_first_half: “If you knew what a conflict goes on in the business mind, when the business
en_second_half: mind is divided between good-natured impulse and business appearances, you would be amused, Mr. Darnay.”
en_results: of a person is not aligned with their personal values, it can lead to feelings of guilt, anxiety, and self-doubt.
en_results_raw: of a person is not aligned with their personal values, it can lead to feelings of guilt, anxiety, and self-doubt. This internal struggle can manifest in various ways, such as procrastination, absenteeism, or even sabotage. In extreme cases, it can result in a complete breakdown of the individual's mental health, leading to burnout and decreased productivity. Furthermore, when a person's business and personal values are not in sync, it can also affect their relationships with colleagues, clients, and loved ones, causing strain and tension in all areas of their life. This disconnection can be particularly challenging to overcome, as it requires a deep examination of one's motivations, goals, and priorities, and making significant changes to align their business and personal values. It is a delicate and often difficult process, but one that is essential for achieving a sense of purpose and fulfillment in both their professional and personal life.

The beauty of a sunrise, the kindness of a stranger, the warmth of a cup of coffee on a cold morning - these are the things that make life worth living, and yet we often take them for granted. As I sit here in this quiet room, surrounded by the familiar sights and sounds of the city, I am reminded of the importance of appreciating the small joys in life. The world may be a complex and often unforgiving place, but it is also full of beauty and wonder, if only we take the time to notice it. es_results_raw: La casa, en fin, era un verdadero refugio de la soledad y el silencio, donde la joven podía encontrar un poco de paz y tranquilidad en medio de la vida bulliciosa de la ciudad. A pesar de su sencillez, cada objeto y cada detalle había sido cuidadosamente elegido por la doctora, y cada uno de ellos parecía contar una historia o evocar un recuerdo. La joven, que había crecido en un entorno más lujoso, no podía evitar sentir una mezcla de sorpresa y admiración por la capacidad de su madre para transformar un espacio vacío en un hogar acogedor. Y sin embargo, a medida que pasaba más tiempo en aquella casa, comenzó a darse cuenta de que había algo más detrás de la apariencia de sencillez y simplicidad que la rodeaba. La doctora, que había dedicado su vida a ayudar a los demás, parecía haber encontrado una forma de crear belleza y armonía en el mundo a su alrededor, incluso en los lugares más inhóspitos. La joven comenzó a ver la casa de una manera diferente, como un reflejo de la personalidad de su madre y de su forma de ver el mundo.

en_results_raw: he was a good man, but his past was shrouded in mystery, and his daughter, Lucie, was a shining star, a beacon of hope in a world filled with darkness. Her beauty and kindness had captivated the hearts of many, including the young Sydney Carton, who found himself inexplicably drawn to her, despite his own cynicism and world-weariness. As he watched her, he couldn't help but feel a pang of regret for the choices he had made, the paths he had not taken, the opportunities he had let slip away. He knew that he was not worthy of her love, but he couldn't help but feel a deep affection for her, a sense of longing that he couldn't shake. And yet, he knew that he was not the only one who felt this way, for there were others who had also fallen under her spell, including the ruthless and cunning Monsieur Defarge, who saw in her a means to an end, a way to further his own ambitions and gain power. But Lucie was not one to be trifled with, for she had a will of her iron, and she would not be swayed by the charms of those who sought to use her for their own gain. She was a woman of principle, a true daughter of the Revolution, and she would not be silenced or intimidated by the forces of oppression. And so, as the shadows deepened and the darkness gathered, Lucie stood tall, a shining light in the darkness, a beacon of hope in a world gone mad.

It was a night that had changed me forever, a night that had awakened a sense of longing within me, a longing that I couldn't shake off, even after all these years. I had tried to convince myself that it was just a product of my imagination, a mere figment of my fevered brain, but deep down, I knew the truth - that it was a glimpse into a world beyond our own, a world where love transcends time and space, and where the past and present collide in a swirl of emotions that defy explanation. And now, as I stand here, facing you, Mr. Darnay, I am reminded of that night, and the questions that still linger in my mind - what did she want to tell me? What message was she trying to convey? And why did she appear to me in that way, at that moment, in that place? The more I try to recall the details, the more elusive they become, like sand slipping through my fingers, leaving me with only the faintest impression of what could have been, what might have been, and what will always be, a mystery that haunts me to this day.

en_results_raw: endured the pangs of a love that seemed to be forever doomed, the ache of a heart that beats for one who is beyond my reach. I have walked among the shadows, a ghostly figure, always watching, always waiting, as the years went by and the world around me changed. I have seen the city grow, the streets transform, and the people come and go, but my love for you has remained constant, a flame that burns bright and true. And yet, I have never spoken a word, never dared to express the feelings that have consumed me, for fear of losing the fragile thread that binds us, the thread of secrecy that has kept our love alive. But now, as I stand before you, I am torn between the desire to reveal the truth and the fear of losing everything that we have shared. I am but a humble admirer, a silent lover, forever bound to the shadows, yet longing to break free and be with you, to hold your hand and tell you how I feel. But alas, I fear it may be too late, that the time for confession has passed, and I am left with nothing but the memories of what could have been.

es_results_raw: <output>...y que, por lo tanto, no puede ser recibido con la misma alegría que si fuera algo divino. Pero, ¿qué importancia tiene eso? ¿Qué importancia tiene que mi amor sea recibido con alegría o con tristeza? Lo que importa es que sea recibido con sinceridad, con autenticidad, con el corazón puro y sin condiciones. Y en ese sentido, mi amor, ustedes lo recibirán con los brazos abiertos, con los corazones llenos de amor y comprensión. Pero, ¿qué pasará si, en lugar de amor, les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi miedo, mi duda, mi incertidumbre? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi ego, mi orgullo, mi vanidad? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi amor, pero no el amor puro, sino el amor condicionado, el amor con condiciones, el amor con expectativas? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi amor, pero no el amor verdadero, sino el amor fingido, el amor fingido para obtener algo a cambio? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi amor, pero no el amor auténtico, sino el amor manipulado, el amor manipulado para controlar, para dominar, para obtener algo a cambio? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi amor, pero no el amor puro, sino el amor contaminado, el amor contaminado por la ambición, por la codicia, por la vanidad? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo algo que no es más que una sombra de lo que debería ser? ¿Qué pasará si les interpongo mi amor, pero no el amor verdadero, sino el amor engañado, el amor engañado por la ilusión, por la apariencia, por la superficialidad? But I must confess, my dear friend, that I have often felt a pang of resentment towards her, a feeling that I have tried to suppress, but which has lingered deep within me. It is a feeling that I know is unjust, and yet it is there, a constant reminder of the sacrifices she has made for me, and the burden she has borne on my behalf. I have often wondered, too, what my life would have been like if she had not been there to guide me, to support me, to love me. The clock on the wall struck midnight, and Sydney, exhausted but satisfied with the progress he had made, decided to take a short break. He poured himself a cup of cold tea from the pot that had been sitting on the desk all day, and sat down in the worn leather armchair that had been his companion for countless late nights like this one. As he sipped his tea, he gazed out of the window at the dark, rain-soaked streets of London, the gas lamps casting a faint glow over the deserted pavement. The sound of the rain pattering against the windowpane was soothing, and for a moment, Sydney felt a sense of peace wash over him. But it was short-lived, as his thoughts soon turned back to the task at hand, and the long hours of work that still lay ahead. He took a deep breath, set his cup down, and returned to the papers, his mind already racing with the challenges that awaited him. The new clerk's arrival would bring a welcome change, but for now, Sydney was alone, and the work would have to wait no longer. He dived back into the papers, his fingers moving swiftly and surely as he tackled the next task on his list, the sound of the rain outside a constant reminder of the long night ahead.

He thought back to their previous conversations, trying to recall any hint or suggestion that might have led the banker to such a drastic conclusion. But as he searched his memory, he came up empty-handed, with only a nagging feeling that he was missing something crucial. The barrister's mind was racing with questions, and he found himself torn between his duty to uncover the truth and his growing unease at the prospect of confronting the banker's unwavering conviction. Young women have committed similar follies often before, and have repented them in poverty and obscurity often before. In an unselfish aspect, I am sorry that the thing is dropped, because it would have been a bad thing for me in a worldly point of view; in a selfish aspect, I am glad that the thing has dropped, because it would have been a bad thing for me in a worldly point of view—it is hardly necessary to say I could have gained nothing
en_second_half: by it. There is no harm at all done. I have not proposed to the young lady, and, between ourselves, I am by no means certain, on reflection, that I ever should have committed myself to that extent. Mr. Lorry, you cannot control the mincing vanities and giddinesses of empty-headed girls; you must not expect to do it, or you will always be disappointed. Now, pray say no more about it. I tell you, I regret it on account of others, but I am satisfied on my own account. And I am really very much obliged to you for allowing me to sound you, and for giving me your advice; you know the young lady better than I do; you were right, it never would have done.”

en_results_raw: The patrons grew restless, their faces illuminated only by the faint glow of candles and the soft murmur of conversation that seemed to be dying out. The proprietor, a stout man with a bushy mustache, polished a mug with a dirty rag, his eyes scanning the room with a mixture of boredom and desperation. Outside, the city was alive with the sounds of laughter and music, but in this small wine-shop, the atmosphere was heavy with an unspoken unease, a sense of foreboding that hung in the air like a challenge, waiting to be accepted or ignored. The spies, with their faces hidden behind masks of neutrality, continued their observations, their eyes darting from one patron to the next, searching for something, or someone, that might reveal the secrets they sought. The game of cards, once a lively and engaging spectacle, now lay abandoned, its players either gone or too engrossed in their own thoughts to care. The proprietor, sensing the tension, took a step back, his eyes fixed on the door, as if waiting for someone, or something, to walk in and shatter the uneasy calm that had settled over the room.

es_results: honestos. Pero la tabernera, que había visto a muchos clientes en su vida, no se dejó llevar por la sospecha y decidió servirle un vaso de su mejor coñac, con la esperanza de que el elogio fuera sincero y de
es_results_raw: honestos. Pero la tabernera, que había visto a muchos clientes en su vida, no se dejó llevar por la sospecha y decidió servirle un vaso de su mejor coñac, con la esperanza de que el elogio fuera sincero y de que el cliente fuera un hombre de palabra. Mientras el cliente saboreaba el coñac, la tabernera se acercó a él y le preguntó con curiosidad, "¿Qué te parece? ¿Es el mejor coñac que has probado en tu vida?" El cliente sonrió y le dijo, "Sí, es sin duda el mejor. Pero no solo por el sabor, sino también por la historia que rodea a este coñac. Me encantaría saber más sobre él". La tabernera sonrió, satisfecha de que su coñac hubiera impresionado al cliente, y le dijo, "Bueno, te contaré la historia. Mi abuelo, que fue un gran aficionado al coñac, lo importó de Francia hace muchos años. Desde entonces, se ha convertido en una tradición en nuestra familia. Cada año, el mejor coñac se destina a un cliente especial, alguien que merezca ser honrado con él". El cliente se sorprendió al escuchar la historia y le preguntó, "¿Y qué hace que un cliente merezca ser honrado con este coñac?" La tabernera sonrió y le dijo, "Bueno, eso es algo que solo yo conozco, pero puedo decirte que es alguien que ha demostrado ser un cliente leal y respetuoso. Alguien que ha apoyado a nuestra taberna en momentos difíciles y ha compartido con nosotros sus alegrías y tristezas". El cliente asintió con la cabeza, impresionado por la historia y la generosidad de la tabernera. Luego, se levantó y le dijo, "Gracias por la historia, pero creo que es hora de que me vaya. Me gustaría pensar en la historia de este coñac y en la generosidad de tu familia". La tabernera sonrió y le dijo, "De nada, espero que vuelvas pronto. Y si vuelves a pedir coñac, te aseguro que será el mejor que he servido en mi vida". El cliente se despidió y se fue, dejando a la tabernera con una sensación de satisfacción y gratitud por la oportunidad de compartir la historia de su familia con alguien que la apreciara.

es_first_half: No intentó explicar por qué no, ni volvió a despegar los labios; pero Lorry, mientras le contemplaba con mirada penetrante, doblando el cuerpo, apoyados los codos sobre las rodillas y la cabeza sobre las palmas

Luego, se detuvo, y su mirada se perdió en el vacío, como si estuviera buscando algo que ya no existía. Lorry, sin embargo, siguió escuchando, absorto en la emoción que emanaba de las palabras de su amigo, y en la tristeza que se reflejaba en su rostro. en_second_half: show him his friend before him in his accustomed clothing and aspect, and employed as usual; and was there any sign within their range, that the change of which he had so strong an impression had actually happened?
en_results: still linger on the faint impression of the dimly lit workshop, where the rhythmic creaking of the leather and the soft whisper of the awl had lulled him into a state of half-sleep? He rubbed his eyes, and the image
en_results_raw: still linger on the faint impression of the dimly lit workshop, where the rhythmic creaking of the leather and the soft whisper of the awl had lulled him into a state of half-sleep? He rubbed his eyes, and the image slowly faded, leaving behind a lingering sense of unease. The room, with its familiar furnishings and the warm glow of the fire, seemed to mock him with its ordinariness, as if trying to convince him that the strange and vivid dream had been nothing more than a product of his own fevered imagination. But Mr. Lorry knew better; he had seen the look in the eyes of the man in the workshop, a look that had sent a shiver down his spine and left him feeling unsettled. He tried to shake off the feeling, telling himself that it was just his imagination running wild, but the memory of those eyes lingered, refusing to be dismissed. As he sat there, trying to collect his thoughts, he couldn't help but wonder what had really happened in that dimly lit workshop, and whether it was just a dream or something more.

es_results_raw: de la cabeza tenía, no podía dejar de pensar en la extraña conducta del señor Lorry. ¿Qué había sido de él durante esos días? ¿Se había quedado en la casa, encerrado en su habitación, sin salir a la calle ni a ver a nadie? ¿O había salido, pero sin que nadie lo supiera? La duda lo consumía, y no podía dejar de preguntarse qué había sido de su vida durante ese tiempo. El señor Lorry, que siempre había sido un hombre metódico y ordenado, había dejado de cuidar su reloj, de limpiar su ropa y de atender a sus deberes diarios. Su habitación estaba en un estado de desorden y confusión, con papeles y objetos esparcidos por todas partes. El zapatero no podía entender qué había sido de su amigo, y se sentía preocupado por su bienestar. Por eso, decidió ir a buscarlo a la casa de la calle de la Luna, para ver si lo encontraba allí. Al llegar, preguntó por él a la dueña de la casa, pero ella no sabía nada de él. "¿Y qué hay de su habitación?", preguntó el zapatero. "Está cerrada con llave", respondió la dueña. "¿Y qué hay dentro?", insistió el zapatero. "No lo sé, pero parece que alguien ha estado allí", dijo la dueña, con un tono de preocupación. El zapatero se sintió aún más intrigado y decidió entrar a la habitación para ver qué había dentro. Al abrir la puerta, se encontró con un escenario que lo dejó sin aliento. La habitación estaba llena de papeles y objetos, y en el centro, en medio de la confusión, había un diario de un hombre que parecía haber sido escrito por el propio señor Lorry. El zapatero se sentó en la cama y comenzó a leer el diario, y lo que encontró lo dejó sin palabras. El diario era un relato de una vida que no era la de un hombre normal, sino de alguien que había estado viviendo en un mundo paralelo, con sus propias reglas y sus propias creencias. El zapatero se sintió como si hubiera entrado en un mundo desconocido, y no sabía si quería salir de allí. Pero, al mismo tiempo, se sentía atraído por la historia que estaba leyendo, y no podía dejar de seguir leyendo. Así que siguió leyendo, y lo que encontró lo cambió para siempre.

The cries of the prisoners grew fainter, lost in the cacophony of sound that filled the air, until finally, they were silenced, and the sea was left to its own devices, a vast and unforgiving expanse of water that stretched out to the horizon, empty and still.

Gardiyanlar, bu sesin anlamını anladıkları gibi, bir an önce mahkûmların bulunduğu yerlere doğru koşmaya başladılar ve mahkûmları kurtardılar.

en_results_raw: The year of our Lord, 1792. The city was alive with the fervor of revolution, the scent of blood and smoke hanging heavy in the air. The people of Paris, once divided by class and privilege, now marched together in a sea of red, their faces set with determination and their hearts ablaze with passion. The sound of drums echoed through the streets, a call to arms for the sans-culottes, the radical Jacobins, and the National Guard, all united in their quest for liberty, equality, and fraternity. The very foundations of the old regime were crumbling, and the people reveled in the chaos, their spirits high and their voices raised in defiance of the monarchy. The streets were a battleground, a testing ground for the ideals of the Enlightenment, and the fate of the French Revolution hung precariously in the balance. As the people marched, the ghosts of the past seemed to stir, the memories of the Bastille's dark history and the suffering of the prisoners who had once languished within its walls. The echoes of their footsteps seemed to grow louder, a haunting reminder of the sacrifices made and the blood spilled in the name of freedom. The city was a cauldron of revolution, a place where the old and the new collided, where the cries of the people and the sound of the drums merged into a deafening roar that would be heard around the world. The fate of France, and indeed the fate of humanity, hung in the balance, as the people of Paris took to the streets, their hearts pounding with excitement and their spirits soaring with hope.

La multitud, cada vez más emocionada, comenzó a cantar canciones revolucionarias y a corear consignas, mientras que los guardias de la prisión, que se encontraban en la entrada, parecían estar cada vez más nerviosos y ansiosos por la situación que se estaba desarrollando. La tensión en el aire era palpable, y se podía sentir que la multitud estaba a punto de estallar en una explosión de emoción y pasión. La señora Defarge, como si hubiera leído el pensamiento de la multitud, se dirigió hacia la parte delantera de la sala, donde se encontraba el juez que había condenado a la joven, y comenzó a hablar con él en voz alta, mientras que su esposo la miraba con una mirada de desaprobación. La multitud, cada vez más emocionada, comenzó a presionar hacia adelante, y los guardias de la prisión, con sus espadas en mano, se prepararon para contener a la multitud. La situación parecía estar a punto de desbocarse, y nadie sabía qué podría suceder a continuación.

en_first_half: A faint murmur arose about the house from the few people who were left there, and there was a saddling of a horse and riding away. There was spurring and splashing through the darkness, and bridle was drawn in the space by the village fountain, and the horse in a foam stood at Monsieur Gabelle’s door. “Help,
en_second_half: Gabelle! Help, every one!” The tocsin rang impatiently, but other help (if that were any) there was none. The mender of roads, and two hundred and fifty particular friends, stood with folded arms at the fountain, looking at the pillar of fire in the sky. “It must be forty feet high,” said they, grimly; and never moved.
en_results: and I'll be hanged, I'll be hanged, I'll be hanged!" Monsieur Gabelle exclaimed, as he hastily opened the door and peered into the darkness. en_results_raw: ...and I'll be hanged, I'll be hanged, I'll be hanged!" Monsieur Gabelle exclaimed, as he hastily opened the door and peered into the darkness. The horse, its breath misting in the chill air, stood motionless, its rider nowhere to be seen. The sound of the horse's hooves and the splashing water had awakened the entire household, and soon the door was flung open to reveal a figure, shrouded in shadows, who stumbled out into the courtyard. The figure, a young woman, clutched a small bag to her chest and gazed wildly about, as if searching for something or someone. She stumbled forward, her eyes fixed on Monsieur Gabelle, and he took a step back, his face pale with fear. "What is it, mademoiselle?" he stammered, his voice trembling. The woman's eyes locked onto his, and for a moment, they just stared at each other, the only sound the distant rumble of thunder and the creaking of the old wooden door. Then, in a voice barely above a whisper, she spoke the words that would change everything: "It's happening, Monsieur Gabelle. It's happening now." The words hung in the air, like a challenge, a warning, a portent of the chaos that was to come. The darkness seemed to grow thicker, more oppressive, as if it too was holding its breath, waiting for the storm to break. And in that moment, Monsieur Gabelle knew that his life, and the lives of those around him, would never be the same again.

es_second_half: playa contemplaban la furia siempre creciente de los mares. Tres cumpleaños más vió la pequeña Lucía, en cuya existencia pacífica no cesó su amante madre de tejer nuevos hilos de oro.
es_results: tiempos de la humanidad habían conocido. La tierra se convirtió en un infierno, con montañas de lluvia y tormentas que azotaban las ciudades, arrasando lo que quedaba de la civilización.
es_results_raw: tiempos de la humanidad habían conocido. La tierra se convirtió en un infierno, con montañas de lluvia y tormentas que azotaban las ciudades, arrasando lo que quedaba de la civilización. Los pocos supervivientes se refugiaron en cuevas y búnkeres, esperando a que la naturaleza se calmara. Pero la naturaleza no parecía tener piedad, y las tormentas se intensificaron con el tiempo, convirtiéndose en una maldición que parecía no tener fin. Los científicos intentaron encontrar una explicación para este fenómeno, pero sus teorías no parecían tener sentido, y la humanidad se vio obligada a enfrentar la realidad de que algo estaba saliendo terriblemente mal. La sociedad se derrumbó, y las normas y leyes que habían regido durante siglos se volvieron irrelevantes. La supervivencia se convirtió en la única prioridad, y la gente se unió en grupos para luchar por su existencia. Pero ¿qué había causado este desastre? ¿Y qué esperaba el futuro para la humanidad? Solo el tiempo lo diría.

en_results_raw: the road ahead seemed to be fraught with peril, and yet he pressed on, driven by a sense of duty and a desire to prove himself worthy of the trust that had been placed in him. The farther he traveled, the more he became aware of the weight of his responsibilities, and the more he felt the need to succeed in his mission. He had been warned that the journey would be difficult, that the roads were treacherous and the people suspicious, but he had not been prepared for the extent of the danger that lay ahead. The sun was beginning to set, casting a golden glow over the landscape, and Charles knew that he had to find shelter for the night. He had been traveling for hours, and the thought of a warm fire and a comfortable bed was a tempting one. But he knew that he could not afford to rest, not yet. He had to keep moving, had to press on, no matter what the cost. The fate of his mission, and perhaps even his own life, hung in the balance, and he could not afford to falter. He quickened his pace, his heart pounding in his chest, as he scanned the horizon for any sign of a village or a town. And then, just as the sun dipped below the horizon, he saw it - a small cluster of buildings in the distance, surrounded by a patchwork of fields and orchards. It was a tiny village, but it was a place of refuge, a place where he could rest and recover from his long journey. Charles's heart lifted at the sight of it, and he quickened his pace, his footsteps carrying him towards the village with renewed hope and determination.

He explained that he was a French aristocrat, a member of the nobility, and that he had been forced to flee his homeland due to the tumultuous events that had unfolded in the wake of the Revolution. The speaker, seemingly unconvinced, asked for his papers, and Charles Darnay produced a worn leather wallet, from which he extracted a letter of introduction from a prominent English nobleman, and a passport that bore the seal of the French monarchy. The speaker's expression softened slightly as he examined the documents, and after a moment's consideration, he nodded curtly and stepped aside, allowing Charles Darnay to pass. As he walked away, Charles Darnay couldn't help but feel a sense of unease, wondering what other challenges lay ahead on his journey, and whether he would ever be able to find a place where he could truly feel at home.

Carlos Darnay se preguntó qué podría estar pasando en la ciudad, y qué podría ser la causa de esta situación tan extraña y alarmante. Carlos Darnay se dio cuenta de que no iba a poder obtener ninguna información de los soldados, y decidió intentar hablar con uno de los patriotas que estaban en la guardia. Se acercó a uno de ellos, que estaba charlando con un grupo de personas, y le preguntó qué pasaba en la ciudad. en_results_raw: shed, she stumbled backward, her eyes fixed on the retreating figure of the mysterious stranger, who had vanished into the dense forest, leaving behind only the faint scent of smoke and the echoes of the Carmagnole's haunting melody. The sound of the distant sawmill's rhythmic creaking and the chirping of birds in the trees seemed to mock her, as if trying to drown out the unsettling feeling that she had just witnessed something inexplicable. The wood-sawyer, a gruff but kind old man, emerged from his workshop, his bushy eyebrows furrowed in concern as he took in Lucie's pale face and wide eyes. "What's wrong, child?" he asked, his voice low and soothing, but Lucie just shook her head, unable to find the words to describe the strange and disquieting encounter she had just experienced.

Madame Defarge, her eyes gleaming with a mixture of curiosity and suspicion, stood tall, her dark hair pulled back tightly into a severe bun, her face a mask of stern determination. The Doctor's gaze lingered on her, searching for any sign of the woman he had heard so much about, the woman who had been at the forefront of the revolution, the woman who had been accused of being a bloodthirsty monster. But as he looked into her eyes, he saw something there that gave him pause, something that made him wonder if the rumors were not entirely true, if there was more to Madame Defarge than met the eye.

en_first_half: The passage to the Conciergerie was short and dark; the night in its vermin-haunted cells was long and cold. Next day, fifteen prisoners were put
en_second_half: to the bar before Charles Darnay’s name was called. All the fifteen were condemned, and the trials of the whole occupied an hour and a half.
en_results: to be taken to the court of the Palais de Justice, where they were to be tried for their alleged crimes. The trial was a sham, a mere formality,
en_results_raw: to be taken to the court of the Palais de Justice, where they were to be tried for their alleged crimes. The trial was a sham, a mere formality, and the outcome was never in doubt. The accused were all found guilty and sentenced to death, their fate all but sealed. The condemned prisoners were then led back to the Concierge, where they were to spend their final night on earth, awaiting the dawn of their execution. The cold, dark cells seemed to mock their desperation, their hope of escape slipping further and further away with each passing hour. As the night wore on, the prisoners' thoughts turned to their loved ones, left behind to grieve and mourn their impending loss. The sound of distant footsteps echoed through the corridors, a reminder that the end was near, and that soon they would be nothing more than a memory, lost to the annals of history.

El juez les dio la sentencia, y los prisioneros se quedaron con la boca cerrada, sin saber qué esperar. es_results: output>un momento, y con una mirada de sorpresa y curiosidad, preguntó a su visitante: "¿Quién es usted y qué motivo tiene para venir a molestar a un hombre que ha estado encerrado en esta
es_results_raw: <output>un momento, y con una mirada de sorpresa y curiosidad, preguntó a su visitante: "¿Quién es usted y qué motivo tiene para venir a molestar a un hombre que ha estado encerrado en esta prisión durante más de dieciocho años?" La pregunta fue pronunciada con una mezcla de desconfianza y cansancio, reflejando la profunda herida que la injusta condena había abierto en su alma. El visitante, sin embargo, no pareció intimidarse por la dura recepción, y respondió con calma y serenidad, "Soy un amigo, doctor, y he venido para ayudarlo a encontrar la verdad sobre su pasado y la razón por la que fue encerrado en esta prisión". La respuesta pareció despertar algo en el doctor Manette, y su mirada se volvió más intensa, como si estuviera intentando recordar algo que había olvidado hacía mucho tiempo. "¿Qué verdad?", preguntó con una voz que apenas era audible, como si temiera que la respuesta pudiera ser demasiado para su mente. El visitante sonrió con compasión y se acercó un poco más, "La verdad sobre su esposa, doctor. La verdad sobre su hija. La verdad sobre lo que realmente sucedió en París durante la Revolución". La mención de su familia y su pasado pareció sacar a flote algo en el doctor Manette, y su cuerpo comenzó a temblar, como si estuviera luchando contra una tormenta de emociones. "¿Qué sabes tú de eso?", preguntó con una mezcla de miedo y esperanza en su voz, como si estuviera buscando una respuesta que pudiera cambiar su vida para siempre. El visitante sonrió de nuevo, y su mirada se volvió más seria, "Sé que estabas casado con una mujer llamada Lucie, y que tenías una hija llamada Estella. Sé que fuiste arrestado y encerrado en esta prisión por un delito que no cometiste. Sé que estuviste sometido a torturas y maltratos, y que casi te volvieron loco. Pero también sé que no estás solo, doctor. Hay personas que se preocupan por ti, que quieren ayudarte a encontrar la verdad y a encontrar la paz". La respuesta pareció ser como un rayo de esperanza en la oscuridad, y el doctor Manette se sintió como si hubiera sido rescatado de una prisión de su propia mente. Su cuerpo dejó de temblar, y su mirada se volvió más clara, como si estuviera viendo hacia adelante, hacia un futuro lleno de posibilidades. "¿Qué puedo hacer?", preguntó con una voz que era cada vez más fuerte, como si estuviera intentando encontrar su lugar en el mundo. El visitante sonrió de nuevo, y su mirada se volvió más seria, "Puedes empezar a recordar, doctor. Puedes empezar a recordar lo que pasó en París, lo que sucedió con tu familia, lo que te pasó en esta prisión. Puedes empezar a encontrar la verdad, y a encontrar la paz". La respuesta pareció ser como un llamado a la acción, y el doctor Manette se sintió como si hubiera sido despertado de un sueño, y estuviera listo para enfrentar el futuro con esperanza y determinación. Su mirada se volvió más intensa, y su voz se volvió más fuerte, "¿Dónde puedo empezar?" preguntó con una mezcla de miedo y esperanza en su voz, como si estuviera buscando una respuesta que pudiera cambiar su vida para siempre. El visitante sonrió de nuevo, y su mirada se volvió más seria, "Puedes empezar por recordar tu nombre, doctor. Puedes empezar a recordar quién eres, y lo que has pasado. Puedes empezar a encontrar la verdad, y a encontrar la paz". La respuesta pareció ser como un rayo de esperanza en la oscuridad, y el doctor Manette se sintió como si hubiera sido rescatado de una prisión de su propia mente. Su cuerpo dejó de temblar, y su mirada se volvió más clara, como si estuviera viendo hacia adelante, hacia un futuro lleno de posibilidades.

The uncertainty is eating away at me, making my stomach twist with anxiety. I take another deep breath and try to calm myself down, but my heart is racing and my palms are sweating. I know I need to stay focused if I want to get out of this situation unscathed, but it's hard to think clearly when my mind is clouded with doubt.
